Rule.NonCompliantComment: The system does not display a proper message of the day, leaving users uninformed about authorized usage.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Configure /etc/motd with a standard warning message.
Rule.Correction: echo "Authorized users only. Unauthorized access is prohibited." > /etc/motd
Rule.Verification: grep -q "Unauthorized access is prohibited" /etc/motd && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The local login warning banner is missing or misconfigured.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Configure /etc/issue with a proper local login warning message.
Rule.Correction: echo "Unauthorized access to this system is prohibited." > /etc/issue

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The remote login warning banner is missing or misconfigured.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Configure /etc/issue.net with an appropriate remote login warning message.
Rule.Correction: echo "Unauthorized access to this network is prohibited." > /etc/issue.net

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The file permissions on /etc/motd allow unauthorized modifications.
The file permissions on /etc/issue are too permissive.
The file permissions on /etc/issue.net are too permissive.
